item.description:
Title:  "Easy-Moderate Hike with beautiful views followed by Cookout" -- join the hike, or the cookout or both! Date:  Saturday April 9:  11am (Hike)  2:30pm (Cookout)   Trail map http://guilfordlandtrust.org/wordpress/maps/northwoodsmap.pdf This is an event sponsored by Barbra.  Al-r has also listed this on his site.  This is a beautiful area to hike.  This is rolling area that should be doable for this early time of the year.  This is not a strenuous start to the season.  Come and enjoy the hike and new friends and a potluck afterwards. Mattabesett Trail (Bluff Head), Guilford CT: This trail has some great views and interesting climbs.  We begin with a  a vertical climb (about 20 minutes) followed with lovely cliff walking trails with plenty of views.  Atop Bluff head (remnant of molten rock) one can see long island sound to the right and the mountains’ of plenty to the left.  Across the way are the Mica Ledges.  This will be a 4-5 mile loop hike that should take not more than 3 hours. We will walk at a slow pace.   Meet at 11AM at the Rte. 77 parking area for the Mattabesett Trail (on Route 77 (Durham Road, Guilford CT), Coming from 91 N, take Durham Exit onto route 68 to 17 to 77.  It is located 4.6 miles south of Durham Center or 4.3 miles north of Rte. 80 in Guilford. This will be both our starting location and our ending location. From the Hartford area, the address is approximately 4550 Durham Rd Guilford. 91 south to 9 south, to the exit for rt. 17(maybe 13), travel through Durham, take 77 south for 4.7 miles.  The parking area is on the right just past Burt Rd.  If you travel to Great Hill Rd you went too far.   More Information: Bluff Head itself is a remnant of molten rock – basalt – arising from under the earth through faults in the earth’s surface some 200 million years ago. The fault line that led to the formation of Bluff Head runs under Route 77 from the north end of Lake Quonnipaug to the parking lot at Bluff Head, where it continues almost due north from the parking lot (just west of Route 77) to a stream running into the north end of Meyerhuber Pond.

 

Potluck Cookout:

The location will be announced to those who respond.  Anticipating that the hike will end around 2-2:30, the cookout will begin soon after.  It will be in Madison home very close to the hike.  Bring the usual potluck things to share with everyone for a picnic.  We'll have a couple of grills going and a firepit.

 

Hope to see you there!

---------------------------

Approximate location/directions for the meetup location, Rte. 77 (Durham Rd.) in Guilford, CT:

http://www.mapquest.com/maps?city=Guilford&state=CT&address=4600+Durham+Rd

 

Alternate directions, use Google Maps (works for lat/long, approx. GPS lat=41.409, long=-72.6959):
http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=41.409+-72.6959+(Hike+meetup%2Fparking+location)&sll=37.771274,-122.411749&sspn=0.008175,0.012295&g=41.409+-72.6959&ie=UTF8&ll=41.409454,-72.695889&spn=0.007371,0.012295&z=16&iwloc=addr

---------------------------

=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "I'm Going" or "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the orange road cones provided by Al-r
